items.sentence: Tom doesn\'t seem to understand why people don\'t like him.
Tom didn\'t learn how to swim until he was in his thirties.
Tom didn\'t read everything as carefully as he should have.
The reason he was absent was that he had a severe headache.
Mary isn\'t really sick. She\'s only pretending to be sick.
That man standing over there next to the maple tree is Tom.
When Tom smiled at Mary, she couldn\'t help but smile back.
I let Tom watch a little TV after he finished his homework.
Tom had a crush on Mary, but she wasn\'t interested in him.
Tom adjusted the seat, put in the key, and then drove away.
Aren\'t you ever going to tell me what happened that night?
Tom decided to buy Mary something special for her birthday.
If I hadn\'t come to Boston, this never would\'ve happened.
If I\'d known that Tom needed help, I could\'ve helped him.
I\'ll do whatever it takes to keep our customers satisfied.
All I had in my pocket was a bus ticket and thirty dollars.
Are there any other problems that need to be taken care of?
Tom says that he can\'t sleep unless it\'s completely dark.
Tom bought his camera at this store about three months ago.
I want everyone to know that I\'m not the one who did that.
